comment: I took Dr. Rybolt for my introductory physics and he was amazing! His lectures and breakouts were helpful and he would offer extra assistance when needed. If you attend, you will succeed in his class. A great professor without a doubt, highly suggest!

Honestly, a great professor with really informative lectures. He's always willing to help students who don't understand, and gives a lot of extra credit. Just come to class, come to the breakouts, do your homework, and you'll get at least a B+ or an A. Unfortunately I wasn't nearly that diligent, but I was still able to pass with a low grade.
take him!!! pretty cool guy
Take this class. If you go to the breakouts and pay attention in class you will succeed. 100% would

Such a good professor, makes all lectures accessible if you're not able to make it with recorded lectures or you can join with teams, he also uploads all of his notes from class to study at home with. Offers extra credit on tests afterwards if your go back and correct the problems your missed.

Easiest lab I have ever taken. Just show up, complete the worksheet, and then you're golden. Good guy he isn't a jerk when you ask him a question like other lab profs. The only annoying thing was working w/ the equipment. Otherwise, the lab is stress-free and one lab is dropped. Take him.

Dr. Rybolt genuinely cares about his students, and he is always willing to help. He gives feedback on tests and sometimes gives partial credit for answers. He treats his students with respect understands that we aren't all physics majors, so he never makes you feel dumb for asking questions. His handwriting is a little messy but you get used to it

You have homework on webassign. A lot of extra credit opportunities. The final replaces your lowest exam grade. Overall great person, but sucks at teaching physics. I feel like with physics it's a lot of hands on and visual representation, which is hard when he isn't neat and organized. part 2/2

Professor is very traditional; he uses powerpoints to teach the material, while also writing on the powerpoints. His handwriting is kind of messy, so it is kind of hard to keep up with his work, which makes it difficult when you try to go back and study it. You have pre-lecture quizzes over the material learned in the previous class. part 1/2

Professor Rybolt is an amazing person.He cares so much about his students. He would always be so helpful during breakout and offers lots of extra credit opportunities.Allows formula sheet on final and on tests. Records and posts all lectures. If you can take him, do it. He makes physics easy and is a super kind, passionate, understanding dude.

His exams are very easy. All you need to do is study his quizzes and attend breakout sessions. He replaces your lowest exam for you final. He also records his lectures so you can always refer to them. A lot of extra credit opportunities! Very nice and genuine person.

Dr. Rybolt is the best professor at Kennesaw State University! His quizzes are very similar to his exams and he makes sure that everyone in class understands the material before moving on. Lowest exam grade gets replaced by final exam & he provides SO much extra credit. It's so hard not to get an A in this class. TAKE HIM!

He made Physics so easy! Very straightforward. The tests are similar to breakout and in-class problems. There are weekly quizzes that are a few questions long over things covered in class that week, and short and simple homework on WebAssign (never more than 10 questions). Very helpful and easy to talk to. Lab with him is good too! Easy grader.

This class was made so much better from Prof. Rybolt. He allows a whole front sheet of paper for you to write whatever you'd like on the paper. His tests are simlar to the breakout worksheets and the study guides. Look at them! Highly recommend

Professor Rybolt is awesome. I could not make it to many of the labs and he was very understanding. He also communicated with me about my grade and gave me an opportunity to raise my grade from a B to an A. Highly recommended!!!

Lecture: He makes this class as easy as possible. Will thoroughly answer any question, no matter how simple. Wants everyone to learn. You get a cheat sheet for the tests. Lab: Not very good at explaining how the lab works but will always help you. So nice.

TAKE FROM DR. RYBOLT!!! This class definitely had some difficult topics but Dr. Rybolt presented so many practice problems, study guides, and formula sheets to help his students prepare for the tests. He also allowed us to use one piece of scratch paper as a cheat sheet. I took his PHYS1112 lecture online and participation was very important!

Most of the weight of the grade comes from 3 exams and the final the rest is a bit too small to make a big difference in your grade. He makes the class fun and changes he lesson based on how well you understand the material so you fully understand. Always give you feedback on exams so you know what to work on and gives a lot of extra credit.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: He tries to make the class fun and always makes sure you understand the subject before moving to the next. If you miss class you'll have a hard time understanding the next material. Allows you make make your own equation sheet to use on the exams.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: I had Dr. Rybolt for lab he is SO caring and genuine. Lab is easy as always, 10 labs with one dropped and those labs are your only grade. He gives mini super helpful pre-lab lectures and always provides graph paper. He makes the KSU lab manual more bearable and is so willing to help your group out during lab. Not a hard grader either!

I only had him for lab, but he is a great lab professor. He is so caring and genuine. 10 labs, and only 9 are counted. The 1112L manual is pretty bad, so he tries to help you navigate through it. He is easy to talk to and a tad bit awkward. Would take again for sure, such a kind guy with relatively simple expectations from the class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: Professor Rybolt is one of those professors who I am willing to take 8am's for the sake that he is an amazing professor. He provides feedback on anything that you are willing to ask for, and his leniency and understanding are apparent both through his grading and his personality. My experience with physics was thoroughly enjoyable because of him.

Three tests and a final, so the lowest test can be replaced with the final. There is web-assign hwk and his breakout sessions are helpful. No textbook required because all the test questions come from his ppt. Nice proff who will reply to emails and office hours are helpful.

This man will literally try to know all of his students names and give you one on one help during the breakout sessions. After a unit he will ask for feedback on the lectures and what you didn't understand and personally email you trying to help you on what you didn't understand. Also, equation sheets are allowed and detailed!

Rybolt does a lot of examples in class and in breakout and asks the class questions from time to time to keep them engaged. He can get a little caught up in proving the equations from time to time, which can get confusing, but he tells you what to pay attention to. No textbook, but you do need WebAssign for the homework
Lab is super easy. Dr. Rybolt has a short pre-lab lecture that explains the experiment and the equations used to calculate things in the lab. A must take!
rating_tags: Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Rybolt really cares for his students and ensures they learn through lecture and breakout section. He effectively tailors the course to the needs of the students while presenting content in a way that's easy to understand and aligned with his exams. As a biologist, I appreciated not having physics thrown down my neck, but ways it relates to me.

A real Gem I tell you. Dr. Rybolt is an excellent lab professor. He makes sure you know how to do the lab before you leave, and even helps you finish it before you leave so you have no homework. Ask if your doing something right and he'll even tell you if the answer is wrong before you turn it it. Honestly wants everyone to pass. Solid Choice!
He is nice but his test are difficult and he always sounds like hes not sure about what hes teaching

Dr. Rybolt genuinely wants his students to succeed in physics. Physics 2 is not an easy class, but he listens to his students to try to improve the class. The tests are a bit challenging, but if you prepare enough for the tests you should be fine. There is usually weekly homework on webassign. No quizzes. Attendance not required.

Dr. Rybolt is an excellent lab professor. His grading is fair and wants you to finish the reports before you leave so that you don't have any homework. He's very understanding and genuinely wants you to understand the material that is emphasized by each lab.
He always connects whatever physics we are learning to the real world, and that helps a lot. It both makes the physics more tangible and keeps it extra-interesting.
In lab, he is really chill and a super easy grader.

Dr. Rybolt is a very kind and caring person. Will do anything to try and help you and is even lenient on extending homework. However, this was his first semester teaching. The first test he gave us was 30 questions for a 50 min class, no one finished. His tests are hard, however for the test 2 and 3 he gave us the opportunity to gain points back.

Took for lecture and lab. Lab was easy. Lecture is more difficult. Homework q's and lectures do not cover the types of q's on exams. He lets you do test corrections so you can get up to 1/2 your points back that you missed. Missed several classes without affecting my understanding too much. Textbook is useless other than solved problems in back.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Tests are tough--Would take again

comment: Definitely recommend him for physics lab! He's super nice and helpful for lab, but heard he's not so great in lecture since it's his first year teaching here. For labs, he sometimes tell you what equations to use to get the data you need. We turn the report in the same day also, and I don't mind since it's less homework for the week.

He is a really nice guy, but a little so-so in lecture. But he is great in recitation and lab. He is always willing to help or give extensions on homework. And he tends to curve the tests, and give bonus and corrections. He really tries to get the class to understand with examples and engaging us and tries make the class somewhat enjoyable.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: Physics is already hard enough. Really nice guy, but he is NOT good at teaching. He is always ready to help, but usually, no matter how hard he tries, is unable to help at all. Do not take if you actually want to understand physics. Attendance isn't mandatory, but it is difficult to catch up if you do miss class.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Rybolt is really good when it comes to recitation and labs. He really wants to see you understand the material, but physics is awful and he isn't great in lecture. Most of the class is conceptual but tests are math based. Homework each week is difficult, four exams, and he gives extra credit and chances to rework missed problems.
Dr. Rybolt is very nice and gives you a chance to rework problems you missed on a test in order to earn points back. He really wants you to understand physics and enjoy yourself during lecture.
